name: Actors Who Became Directors Quiz | Classic Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Paul Newman starred in many movies with his wife, Joanne Woodward. In one instance, he directed her - but did not appear in the cast. Which movie was that?
questions.explanation:
Rachel, Rachel.

	All of the other choices include both Newman and Woodward in the cast."Rally" is a comedy, "Paris" and "Bridge" are romantic dramas. "Rachel" - an early effort by Newman - was well-received.

questions.text: Robert Redford has had a fine career as both an actor and a director. Which of these movies was his first directorial effort?
questions.explanation:
Ordinary People.

	All are Redford efforts - and all are good movies. "People", his first effort, was impressive. Donald Sutherland, Timothy Hutton and  a surprisingly dramatic Mary Tyler Moore in the cast.

questions.text: John Huston isn't a "pure fit" in this category - he's more of a director who has also done some acting. Which of these classic Bogart movies was NOT directed by Huston?
questions.explanation:
High Sierra.

	"Sierra" was Raoul Walsh. The others are classics - especially the legendary "Falcon" and "Treasure".

questions.text: Orson Welles was a man who was more interested in directing than acting - but did both. He was both actor and director in "Citizen Kane"; in which of these other movies was he both actor and director?
questions.explanation:
Touch of Evil.

	"Third" was directed by Carol Reed; Welles had a relatively small acting role. "Compulsion" had him playing a lawyer in a Leopold-Loeb scenario, but he did not direct. "Ambersons" came right after "Kane"; Welles directed, but was not in the cast. "Evil" is the only one of the choices that had him in both roles.

questions.text: Which was the first Western directed by Clint Eastwood?
questions.explanation:
High Plains Drifter.

	Am I the only person who wasn't impressed by these movies? "Pale Rider" was shot in the dark.

questions.text: Jack Lemmon directed long-time friend and co-star Walter Matthau in what movie?
questions.explanation:
Kotch.

	All the choices were Matthau vehicles. For "Kotch", Lemmon stepped behind the camera - not something that the prominent actor often  did.

questions.text: Which movie was directed by Penny Marshall?
questions.explanation:
A League of Their Own.

	Famous for "The Odd Couple" and "Laverne and Shirley", Marshall found directing more to her liking. Tom Hanks, Madonna. "There's no crying in baseball!" ("Tate" was a directing effort by Jodie Foster.)

questions.text: Ron Howard directed the excellent "Apollo 13" (before the excellent "Beautiful Mind"). Who was NOT in the cast of "Apollo 13"?
questions.explanation:
Matt Damon.

	Bacon and Hanks were in space; Harris was on the ground. (Damon was somewhere else.) "Andy Griffith" and "American Graffiti" now seem long ago and far away.

questions.text: Rob Reiner directed the excellent "A Few Good Men". Who spoke the famous words: "You can't handle the truth!"?
questions.explanation:
Jack Nicholson.

	Fine movie, very well done. A far cry from the days of "Meathead" in "All in the Family".

questions.text: Elia Kazan is known as a director, but he appeared as an actor in what classic crime film?
questions.explanation:
City for Conquest.

	Before finding fame as a director in films such as "On The Waterfront", Kazan did some acting - including a role in this James Cagney drama.
